how would you describe your main use cas: As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content);Worldbuilding (e.g. for role-playing games)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
putting it all together, what value does:
Easy way to manage collections of knowledge.

what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I am comfortable writing filter expressions;I have written custom HTML;I have written custom CSS styles;I have written custom JavaScript
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki with custom saver (e.g. TiddlyPWA, Timimi, tw5-browser-nativesaver);Single-file wiki with TiddlyDesktop;Single-file wiki with third-party desktop app (e.g. TidGi Desktop, twexe)
how do you back up/sync changes between: N/A - I keep my wiki on a single system

outside of plugins, palettes and other i: Made a custom palettes, a few plugins, used a example I found online to make the title-optional plugin and the toc-walk plugin. I frequent the discord page TiddlyWiki5 so many knowledgeable people and they are always helping people and each other out.

what could we do better? prompts for thi: Web browsers moving more towards limiting the browsers in the name of protecting us from ourselves and breaking things such as TW.
